title: Table 1: % Children enrolled in different types of schools. By age group and sex. 2024
description: Enrollment data for children in Sikkim for the year 2024, broken down by age groups (6-16) and gender. The table compares enrollment percentages in Government, Private, and Other schools, and includes the percentage of children not currently enrolled in school. It also includes longitudinal trends from 2006 to 2024 regarding out-of-school rates and government school enrollment.
data: | Age group and sex | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in school | Total |

| Year | Std I-V | Std I-V | Std VI-VIII | Std VI-VIII |

title: Table 2: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2022
description: Early childhood education enrollment statistics for Sikkim in 2022. The table details the distribution of children aged 3 to 8 across Anganwadis, Government pre-primary centers, Private LKG/UKG, and formal Government or Private schools.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Anganwadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 3: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2024
description: Early childhood education enrollment statistics for Sikkim in 2024. This table tracks the percentage of children aged 3 to 8 enrolled in Anganwadis, pre-primary institutions, and formal schools, allowing for comparison with 2022 data.

title: Table 4: % Children by grade and reading level. All children. 2024
description: Foundational reading proficiency levels for all children in Sikkim (2024), categorized by Grade (Std I to VIII). The table displays the percentage of students at various reading stages, from 'Not even letter' to 'Standard II level text'.
data: | Std | Not even letter | Letter | Word | Std I level text | Std II level text | Total |

title: Table 5: Trends over time
description: Longitudinal analysis (2014-2024) of reading skills for Standard III students in Sikkim. The table tracks the percentage of children capable of reading Standard II level text, broken down by Government and Private schools.
data: | Year | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text |

title: Table 6: Trends over time
description: Historical trends (2014-2024) of reading proficiency for older students in Sikkim. This table shows the percentage of children in Standard V and Standard VIII who can read Standard II level text, comparing Government and Private school performance.
data: | Year | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text |

title: Table 7: % Children by grade and arithmetic level. All children. 2024
description: Foundational numeracy assessment for Sikkim students in 2024. The table displays the percentage of children in Grades I through VIII categorized by their highest arithmetic capability (Number recognition, Subtraction, Division).

title: Table 8: Trends over time
description: Trends in basic arithmetic proficiency (subtraction) for Standard III children in Sikkim from 2014 to 2024. The data compares the performance of students in Government and Private schools.
data: | Year | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction |

title: Table 9: Trends over time
description: Trends in advanced arithmetic proficiency (division) for Standard V and Standard VIII children in Sikkim from 2014 to 2024. The table compares division capabilities across Government and Private school students.
data: | Year | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division |

title: Table 10: Smartphone availability and use. By age. 2024

title: Table 15: Trends over time
description: Survey coverage data showing the number of Primary and Upper Primary schools visited in Sikkim during the years 2010, 2018, 2022, and 2024.

title: Table 16: Trends over time
description: Attendance trends in Sikkim schools from 2010 to 2024. The table displays the average percentage of enrolled children and teachers present on the day of the visit.

description: Trends regarding school size or specific facility indicators in Sikkim from 2010 to 2024.

title: Table 18: Multigrade classes. 2024

title: Table 21: Foundational Literacy and Numeracy (FLN) activities. 2024
description: Implementation status of Foundational Literacy and Numeracy (FLN) initiatives in Sikkim schools (2023-2025). The data covers government directives, teacher training (offline/online), availability of teaching materials, and school readiness programmes.
data: | % Schools | % Schools | Received a directive from govt to implement FLN activities with Std I-II/III | At least one teacher received training on FLN | At least one teacher received training on FLN | Received Teaching Learning Materials (TLM) for FLN activities** | Received funds for TLM for FLN activities** | School Readiness Programme held for Std l |
